label: St. Martin's Church, Zillis
context: St. Martin's Church in Zillis, Switzerland, is a Romanesque church best known for its painted wooden ceiling panels dating from the 12th century, depicting biblical scenes and symbolic imagery.

label: Neanderthal
context: Neanderthals are an extinct group of archaic humans who inhabited Europe and Western and Central Asia during the Middle to Late Pleistocene.

label: Upper Palaeolithic
context: The Upper Paleolithic (or Upper Palaeolithic) is the third and last subdivision of the Paleolithic or Old Stone Age.

label: British
context: Britons, also known colloquially as Brits,[22] are the citizens and diaspora of the United Kingdom, the British Overseas Territories, and the Crown dependencies.

label: Paul Pettitt
context: Paul Barry Pettitt, FSA is a British archaeologist and academic. He specialises in the Palaeolithic era, with particular focus on claims of art and burial practices of the Neanderthals and Pleistocene Homo sapiens, and methods of determining the age of artefacts from this time. Since 2013, he has been Professor of Archaeology at Durham University.

label: Trinkaus
context: Erik Trinkaus (born December 24, 1948) is an American paleoanthropologist. Trinkaus is a member of the National Academy of Sciences, and the Mary Tileston Hemenway Professor Emeritus of Arts and Sciences at Washington University in St. Louis.

label: Nelson Mandela
context: Nelson Mandela (1918–2013) was a South African anti-apartheid activist and statesman who served as the first president of South Africa from 1994 to 1999.

label: William Shakespeare
context: William Shakespeare (c. 1564–1616) was an English playwright, poet, and actor, widely regarded as one of the greatest writers in the English language.

label: Frida Kahlo
context: Frida Kahlo (1907–1954) was a Mexican painter known for portraits and self-portraits inspired by the nature and culture of Mexico.

label: Serena Williams
context: Serena Williams (born 1981) is an American former professional tennis player, widely regarded as one of the greatest players of all time.

label: Malala Yousafzai
context: Malala Yousafzai (born 1997) is a Pakistani education activist and the youngest Nobel Prize laureate, receiving the Nobel Peace Prize in 2014.

label: Leonardo da Vinci
context: Leonardo da Vinci (1452–1519) was an Italian polymath of the High Renaissance, active as a painter, engineer, and scientist.

label: Isaac Newton
context: Sir Isaac Newton (1643–1727) was an English mathematician, physicist, and astronomer who is widely recognized as one of the most influential scientists of all time and a key figure in the Scientific Revolution.

label: Galileo Galilei
context: Galileo Galilei (1564–1642) was an Italian astronomer, physicist, and engineer, sometimes described as the father of observational astronomy, modern physics, and the scientific method.

label: Nikola Tesla
context: Nikola Tesla (1856–1943) was a Serbian-American inventor and electrical engineer best known for his contributions to the design of the modern alternating current electricity supply system.

label: Charles Darwin
context: Charles Darwin (1809–1882) was an English naturalist, geologist, and biologist, best known for his contributions to the science of evolution by natural selection.

label: Stephen Hawking
context: Stephen Hawking (1942–2018) was an English theoretical physicist, cosmologist, and author, known for his work on black holes and relativity.

label: Elon Musk
context: Elon Musk (born 1971) is a business magnate and investor, known for founding or leading companies such as Tesla, SpaceX, and X.

label: Mark Zuckerberg
context: Mark Zuckerberg (born 1984) is an American business magnate and philanthropist, best known as the co-founder and chief executive officer of Facebook, now Meta Platforms.

label: Jeff Bezos
context: Jeff Bezos (born 1964) is an American business magnate, investor, and founder of Amazon, one of the world's largest e-commerce and cloud computing companies.

label: Bill Gates
context: Bill Gates (born 1955) is an American business magnate, software developer, and philanthropist, best known as the co-founder of Microsoft.

label: Steve Jobs
context: Steve Jobs (1955–2011) was an American business magnate, inventor, and investor, best known as the co-founder of Apple Inc.

label: Barack Obama
context: Barack Obama (born 1961) is an American politician who served as the 44th president of the United States from 2009 to 2017.

label: Abraham Lincoln
context: Abraham Lincoln (1809–1865) was an American lawyer and statesman who served as the 16th president of the United States and led the nation through the American Civil War.

label: George Washington
context: George Washington (1732–1799) was an American military officer and statesman who served as the first president of the United States.

label: Winston Churchill
context: Winston Churchill (1874–1965) was a British statesman, soldier, and writer who served as prime minister of the United Kingdom during World War II.

label: Margaret Thatcher
context: Margaret Thatcher (1925–2013) was a British stateswoman who served as prime minister of the United Kingdom from 1979 to 1990.

label: Mahatma Gandhi
context: Mahatma Gandhi (1869–1948) was an Indian lawyer, anti-colonial nationalist, and political ethicist who employed nonviolent resistance to lead India to independence.

label: Jawaharlal Nehru
context: Jawaharlal Nehru (1889–1964) was an Indian independence activist and statesman who served as the first prime minister of India.

label: Napoleon Bonaparte
context: Napoleon Bonaparte (1769–1821) was a French military leader and emperor who rose to prominence during the French Revolution.

label: Julius Caesar
context: Julius Caesar (100–44 BC) was a Roman general and statesman who played a critical role in the events that led to the rise of the Roman Empire.

label: Cleopatra
context: Cleopatra (69–30 BC) was the last active ruler of the Ptolemaic Kingdom of Egypt, known for her political alliances and relationships with Roman leaders.

label: Socrates
context: Socrates (c. 470–399 BC) was a classical Greek philosopher credited as one of the founders of Western philosophy.

label: Plato
context: Plato (c. 428–348 BC) was a classical Greek philosopher, a student of Socrates, and the founder of the Academy in Athens.

label: Aristotle
context: Aristotle (384–322 BC) was a Greek philosopher and polymath during the Classical period in Ancient Greece, a student of Plato, and tutor to Alexander the Great.

label: Alexander the Great
context: Alexander the Great (356–323 BC) was a king of the ancient Greek kingdom of Macedon who created one of the largest empires in ancient history.

label: Confucius
context: Confucius (551–479 BC) was a Chinese philosopher and politician whose teachings have deeply influenced East Asian thought and culture.

label: Sun Tzu
context: Sun Tzu (c. 544–496 BC) was a Chinese general, military strategist, and philosopher, traditionally credited as the author of The Art of War.

label: Johann Sebastian Bach
context: Johann Sebastian Bach (1685–1750) was a German composer and musician of the Baroque period, known for instrumental compositions such as the Brandenburg Concertos.

label: Ludwig van Beethoven
context: Ludwig van Beethoven (1770–1827) was a German composer and pianist, a crucial figure in the transition between the Classical and Romantic eras in classical music.

label: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
context: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart (1756–1791) was a prolific and influential composer of the Classical period.

label: Pablo Picasso
context: Pablo Picasso (1881–1973) was a Spanish painter, sculptor, and one of the most influential artists of the 20th century.

label: Vincent van Gogh
context: Vincent van Gogh (1853–1890) was a Dutch post-impressionist painter who is among the most famous and influential figures in the history of Western art.

label: Claude Monet
context: Claude Monet (1840–1926) was a French painter, a founder of French Impressionist painting, and the most consistent and prolific practitioner of the movement.

label: Michael Jackson
context: Michael Jackson (1958–2009) was an American singer, songwriter, and dancer, known as the King of Pop and one of the most significant cultural figures of the 20th century.

label: Madonna
context: Madonna (born 1958) is an American singer, songwriter, and actress, often referred to as the Queen of Pop.

label: Taylor Swift
context: Taylor Swift (born 1989) is an American singer-songwriter, known for narrative songs about her personal life and a wide range of musical styles.

label: Cristiano Ronaldo
context: Cristiano Ronaldo (born 1985) is a Portuguese professional footballer, widely regarded as one of the greatest players of all time.

label: Lionel Messi
context: Lionel Messi (born 1987) is an Argentine professional footballer who has won multiple Ballon d'Or awards and is considered one of the greatest players in football history.

label: Muhammad Ali
context: Muhammad Ali (1942–2016) was an American professional boxer and activist, widely regarded as one of the most significant sports figures of the 20th century.

label: Bruce Lee
context: Bruce Lee (1940–1973) was a Hong Kong-American martial artist, actor, and filmmaker, and a cultural icon of the 20th century.

label: Oprah Winfrey
context: Oprah Winfrey (born 1954) is an American talk show host, television producer, and philanthropist, best known for The Oprah Winfrey Show.

label: J. K. Rowling
context: J. K. Rowling (born 1965) is a British author and philanthropist, best known for writing the Harry Potter fantasy series.

label: George Orwell
context: George Orwell (1903–1950) was an English novelist, essayist, and critic, known for works such as 1984 and Animal Farm.

label: Ernest Hemingway
context: Ernest Hemingway (1899–1961) was an American novelist, short-story writer, and journalist, and a Nobel Prize winner in Literature.

label: Albert Camus
context: Albert Camus (1913–1960) was a French philosopher, author, and journalist, best known for his contributions to existentialism and absurdism.

label: Sigmund Freud
context: Sigmund Freud (1856–1939) was an Austrian neurologist and the founder of psychoanalysis.

label: Carl Jung
context: Carl Jung (1875–1961) was a Swiss psychiatrist and psychoanalyst who founded analytical psychology.

label: Noam Chomsky
context: Noam Chomsky (born 1928) is an American linguist, philosopher, and political activist, often described as the father of modern linguistics.

label: Stephen King
context: Stephen King (born 1947) is an American author of horror, supernatural fiction, and fantasy novels.

label: Neil Armstrong
context: Neil Armstrong (1930–2012) was an American astronaut and aeronautical engineer who became the first person to walk on the Moon in 1969.
